Detailed Description

Class that models the hosportal replies database.

It basically is an interface class between the hosportal module and the hosportal replies database. This class provides functions to insert, sort, search, edit and delete entries in the database. This class is solely used by the dbhosportal_messages and the view_single_message_subject class.

Author:
Salman Noor
MIU Intern
School of Electrical Engineering, WITS Unversity
Version:
0.68
Date:
May 3, 2010
Warning:
This class's parent is dbTable which is a chisimba core class.
If the dbTable class is altered in the future. This class may not work.
Apart from normal PHP. This class uses the mysql language to provide the actual functionality. This language is encapsulated with in "double quotes" in a string format.

deleteSingle ( $  id  ) 

Member function to delete an existing entry in the replies database.

Parameters:
id A string. Unique caller id for the exsiting entry.
Warning:
MAKE SURE you are passing the right id as the wrong id will delete the wrong entry.

Delete the entry which that specific id.

The delete function is from the parent class dbTable.

Definition at line 143 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

getNoOfSearchedReplies ( $  subject_matter,
$  searchValue 
)

Member function to get the no of replies that contain the search parameter.

Parameters:
subject_matter A string. The subject matter for a specific group of replies.
searchValue A string. The string could be any small part of the entire comment. Examples choosing the word "can" in a comment that contains the word "canister".
Returns:
An integer of the number of hits made with that specific search parameter.

Get entries with one subject matter according to the subject matter parameter AND

these entries in a temporary variable.

Return the number of entries. Note that is function in part of the parent class dbTable.

init (  ) 

Constructor that set up this class.

It defines the table tbl_hosportal_replies and creates private data members from other classes for this class to use.

Define the table tbl_hosportal_replies. This can only be done if this class is inherited by dbTable.

Instatiate an object user from the class user_module.

Definition at line 38 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

insertSingle ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to insert a new entry into the replies database.

Parameters:
id A string. The id is not unique but the exact same id for the same stored in the messages database
title A string. It is the subject matter of the entry.
comments A string. It is the comment of the entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. how many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
An the same id as was passed in.

Get the user's name that is inserting the entry.

Insert the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If succesful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The insert function is from the parent class dbTable.

return the same id as was passed in.

Definition at line 50 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

listComment ( $  comments  ) 

Member function to search the entire replies database for a certain comment and return it.

Parameters:
comments A string. The comment could be any small part of the entire comment. Examples choosing the word "can" in a comment that contains the word "canister". The modulus signs % allows you to do this.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Returns:
A string that contains the entire comment.

Definition at line 64 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

listSingle ( $  id  ) 

Member function to return a single entry with a specific id.

Parameters:
id A string. This Id is generated by mysql and in unique for all entries. the Id is assigned when you create an entry in the database.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
Make sure you pass the correct id for the entry you want.
Returns:
A single entry with all its fields from the database.

Definition at line 76 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

searchReplies ( $  subject_matter,
$  searchValue,
$  number_of_entries_per_page = 5,
$  starting_element = 0 
)

Member function to get all entries that contain the search parameter.

Parameters:
subject_matter A string. The subject matter for a specific group of replies belonging to a single original message.
searchValue A string. The string could be any small part of the entire comment. Examples choosing the word "can" in a comment that contains the word "canister".
number_of_entries_per_page An Integer. This is to paginate all the entries so it can be view in batches with the default being to view 5 messages at a time.
starting_element An Integer. This integer allow you to paginate. This integer will force the result to start from a specific place in the database.
Note:
In essence, if you want view entries 13 to 15. Then the starting_element will be 13 and the number_of_entries_per_page will be 2.
Returns:
An array of paginated searched entries.

Select all for the replies table with one subject matter according to the subject matter parameter AND the search parameter

or author and order them by latest modified and paginate them and store the result in a temporary variable sql.

Return the array of entries. Note that is function in part of the parent class dbTable.

Definition at line 235 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

sortByLatestModified ( $  subject_matter = '',
$  number_of_entries_per_page = 5,
$  starting_element = 0 
)

Member function to sort all entries by latest modified and return that result as an array.

Parameters:
subject_matter A string. The subject matter for a specific group of replies belonging to a single original message.
number_of_entries_per_page An Integer. This is to paginate all the entries so it can be view in batches with the default being to view 5 messages at a time.
starting_element An Integer. This integer allow you to paginate. This integer will force the result to start from a specific place in the database.
Note:
In essence, if you want view entries 13 to 15. Then the starting_element will be 13 and the number_of_entries_per_page will be 2.
Returns:
An array with the all messages sorted by latest modified.

Select all or * entries from the table hosportal relies with one subject matter according to the subject matter parameter

Convert the temporary variable into an array and return it.

Definition at line 257 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

updateSingle ( $  id,
$  title,
$  comments,
$  unreplied,
$  noofreplies 
)

Member function to edit an existing entry in the replies database.

Parameters:
id A string. Unique caller id for the exsiting entry.
title A string. It is the edited or the same subject matter for the exisitng entry.
comments A string. It is the edited or the same comment for the exisitng entry.
unreplied A Boolean Value. It is to determine whether the entry has been replied to or not.
noofreplies A Integer. How many replies this entry has.
Warning:
Do NOT pass variable types as parameters that are not specified in this member function.
MAKE SURE you have the correct id as the wrong id will edit the wrong entry.
Returns:
The same id for that exisiting entry.

Get the user's name that is editing the exisitng entry.

Update the entry into the database with its relevant fields. If successful, store the entries id into a temporary variable. The update function is from the parent class dbTable.

return the same id for that exisitng entry. The id does not change.

Definition at line 124 of file dbhosportal_replies_class_inc.php.

Field Documentation

$objUser [private]

Private data member of class dbhosportal_replies that stores an object of another class.

This class is composed of one object from the user_module class in the utilities module of chisimba. This object provides options to manipulate and utilize user data.
